Reviews.Title: “hotel on the flight path”
Reviews.Author: godzilla_oz
Reviews.Content: nice & clean hotel but noisy as it is near the airport & on the flight path. the "penthouse" was very nice & good value, sleeps 4 people . big lounge & nice kitchen. friendly staff & rather good breakfast . lots of parking & has restaurents close by. beware : - was told that the independant shuttle service used by the hotel to the pier was $10 each but was charged $20 each upon arrival. better to take a metered taxi than be cheated!

Reviews.Title: “Good for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Ingrid256
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a studio, which was comfortable for the 4 of us, including kitchen and all appliances. Facilities are fine but they look really old. Furniture at the cafeteria need to be changed... breakfast was fine and personnel very kind. Location was very good, close to shopping centers and restaurants. Sleep for me was not very good, since we were close to the airport, it's noisy every now and then-I'm not used to it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for family travel.”
Reviews.Author: Traveler345_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night, pre-cruise. Nice rooms, great staff, fine breakfast, nice property. Yes, the airport is very close. (I guess that's why it has 'Airport west' in the name!) We heard several planes pass overhead but they did not waken us, and we were on the third floor. It did not annoy me and I'm very sensitive to noise. The two bedroom penthouse was exactly what we needed and it was much appreciated when we arrived late at night. Very close to a Wal-Mart for last minute purchases, and right across the street from a nice Mexican restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: GuiltyLisa
Reviews.Content: 2 days before our Superbowl Weekend cruise me and 5 of my closest girlfriends stays at this Residence Inn. It was a great size and spacious for all 6 of us. The staff was friendly and helpful in every way we needed it. The location was great, close to restaurants and walmart. Easy to find and even though its on the approach path to MIA the planes did not bother us one bit.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for flyers”
Reviews.Author: bebo52
Reviews.Content: My husband and I often stay in Residence Inns and like them for the comfort of the room and the full breakfast. The room was very comfortable and there is a nice pool, jacuzzi and tennis court on the premises. Some of the Inns have better breakfast setups than others and I would say this one was at the low end of the spectrum. The wireless access wasn't working in the room when we got there and although someone responded promptly to try to fix it, it didn't really get fixed before we left (and the manager was very apologetic to me about it). This hotel is in the flight path of landing planes so I don't recommend this location for guests who want to sleep during the day but there wasn't much noise at night. It took us about 15 minutes to drive to Miami Beach from this hotel and it is also 15 minutes from the airport/rental car return center.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, near the airport”
Reviews.Author: sithdent
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Marriott Residence Inn near the MIA Airport. The location is great for easy access to the airport. I had a seminar that ended at 4.30 and I had a 6pm flight. I made it there with plenty of time. The room was surprisingly well equipped - full-size fridge, small stove, microwave, coffee maker, even a dishwasher! If I were staying for a longer period of time, esp. with a family and wanted to cook in, it would've been great.

Reviews.Title: “Good for extended stays. Make sure you have a rental car!”
Reviews.Author: Next3Planned
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before we flew home after a cruise. The room could use a little upgrading, but it was ok. If you are staying with multiple people, note that he sink and mirror is outside of the bathroom, which makes it hard to get ready without waking everyone else up. The amenities are excellent such as the refrigerator, microwave, dishwasher, etc. The inn was located within a business park area, which made me feel a little uncomfortable at night because there was nothing around. Make sure you have a rental car if you are staying here! There is a Publix, shopping center, gas station, and fast food within 5 minutes driving distance. It's close to the airport, which was really nice since we had to leave at 8. If you're easy going I think it's a fine place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: tugga11
Reviews.Content: This Residence inn has everything for a long vacation in Miami. The rooms are comfortable, supereb facilities, great service . Rooms have fridge and Microwave. Internet is avaialble. Rooms are very comfortable. Airport is 10 min drive. No near by shops .. may need to go a mile to get everything. All Aeroplanes fly above this hotel sometimes noisy. South beach is 25 min drive. If you are returning rental car to airport - allocate an hour for that, The Miami airport is very big and rental car return is very far away,,

Reviews.Title: “What makes this hotel very good is its STAFF- Such kind customer service!”
Reviews.Author: LPLG09
Reviews.Content: Good elements: - One of the best customer services we ever had - 10 minute drive to the airport (although the sound of planes flying on top may be bothersome to some, not to us) - Has laundrymat on site Not so good elements: - Hotel is a bit older however kitchen appliances are quite good - didn'd find that housekeeping did a top notch job (they clean bathrooms quite ok, but not so much the rest) - towels are quite old and running thin Bad elements: - Internet never worked while we were there - fares are quite cheap In conclusion, we probably would only stay here again due to customer service but not because of anything else ;)

Reviews.Title: “You Better Stay Dressed - Filthy Rooms DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: Bryan F
Reviews.Content: I travel for business 100+ days per year. This Residence Inn near MIA was filthy and unhealthy. Halls smelled of animal urine. When I was in the room, it was filthy and I made sure I wore socks and sweats. After walking from the bathroom to the bed, it was disturbing to see the bottom of my socks. -lots of black long hair attached. A day later, I came down with a case of pink eye. DO NOT STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “February, 2011”
Reviews.Author: Catherine P
Reviews.Content: My husband travels a lot for work for extended periods of time. He often stays at Residence Inns. He stayed at this Residence Inn for about three months and I had the pleasure of visiting several times for a week at a time. I like Residence Inn becuase the chain accomodates people who work with good wifi and good work space. We had a two bedroom suite with a loft bedroom. I used the downstairs bedroom as an office. We slept in the loft, and loved it, but the comments about possible disturbances from the living room and kitchen are accurate. I was not bothered at all by the airplane noise, but there certainly was airplane noise. It is, after all, an airplort hotel. My husband was bitten by some kind of bug before I got there. Probably a spider, and it was a one time occurance. But I didn't see any bugs at all. The pool area is great. I found the pool temperature to be just right. I'm not sure that its heated, but it gets pretty hot in Miami, even in February, and the pool was refreshing, and always clean. I can imagine that the rooms that overlook the pool, basketball court, and barbeque area might hear some noise from the activities there, but security was pretty vigilant about making sure that the noise was kept to a minimum after nine or ten p.m. I never saw anyone in the pool before nine a.m. I didn't avail myself of any shuttle service so I can't speak to that, but, if you have a car available, this hotel is convenient to lots of fun stuff. Dolphin mall, Calle Ocho, Miami Beach, both airports. . . and Chevy's restaurant is walking distance. I didn't eat there, but on Friday nights they have a great dance party and serve some killer margaritas! We also had some fun at a nearby Irish pub that had good food. It was walking distance, though not as close and convenient as Chevy's. The food at the hotel (breakfast every day and appetizers m-th) was as expected. I had a great experience at this hotel. The only complaint I have is that the cleaning crew didn't vaccuum every day. Other than that, everything was clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Stolen CC information and extremely noisy”
Reviews.Author: JoeyTango
Reviews.Content: Many of the previous reviews have accurately complained about the crazy airplane noise at night so I was expecting it. What I didn't expect was to have my CC info stolen. BEWARE!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kudang
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 days yesterday (06/14/11 and 06/15/11) and we will be home tomorrow. Love this place free breakfast and dinner every Mondays through Wednesday. Great pool, great beds, great rooms, great staff, and great location. It rained heavily yesterday but the staff fixed all the mess. I live in Miami and stayed here for my son's 12th birthday. Met a family from Indiana and they just love this place. I always check in a residence inn even when I travel to Canada. Always a reliable brand of hotel. Be back soon hopefully.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: biggs35
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel, no complaints at all, staff brilliant and helpfull, free breakfast and eveing meals couldn`t really wish for anything else. Good value for money. Swimming pool was lovely, even at 9pm in the dark, and still warm. I have noticed alot of complaints about the planes, but it is an airport hotel, so what do you expect really, was enjoyable to watch, Brilliant hotel, would stay again if get the chance to go to miami, rooms nice and spacious for a family of 4.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for families or couples travelling together.”
Reviews.Author: Gord_Nat
Reviews.Content: We had a suite- very large. Full kitchen and living room when you come in. Full bedroom and bath on one side and full bedroom and bath on the other. Good value for a large family or 2 couples. Private. Very clean. No bb!! Airport shuttle every 15min starting at 4am. V Good all around. Front desk person morning of Jan 16th was a bit rude. We were early checking(arrived from cruise ship) in but no need to be rude. A short walk to some shops and restaurants but limited choice in this area. **However, on this Sunday, < 10min walk from the hotel there is an outdoor flea market which I really enjoyed. Very spanish, local. Great atmosphere- a definite highlight if you like that sort of thing. There is a couple of restaurants and a Starbucks on this site. Marriott has 3 hotels(I think) there. We ate at the Marriott Courtyard in the sports bar. It was very good- be carefull, everything is big!!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, but not the place for you if you are a light sleeper”
Reviews.Author: 1tiredpuppy
Reviews.Content: Our family of four spent one night on our way to Key West. Because our flight was so late getting in, we decided to stay in Miami and get up the next morning and drive down. If you are a light sleeper and ear plugs are not your thing, then this is not the place for you. The planes come over all night and day. They are so close you can see people in the windows. It's cool to watch, but not so great when you want some quite time. The front desk staff is top notch and the property it's self is very neat and clean with pretty lush plants. The breakfast was very good with a mix of hot and cold items. Our room was on the ground floor with two full size beds, a den area and a kitchen set up like an efficiency appartment. The bathroom was a split set up with the sinks being outside the shower area.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, awful location”
Reviews.Author: SeattleCat
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because I like the Marriott brand and expect a high level of service from them. While not the nicest Marriott hotel that I have been to, it serves its purpose as an extended stay residence. The primary issue is the noise. There is a train track next to the property, a highway across the street, and it is directly under the landing path of one of the airport's runways. I have served on an aircraft carrier, having plane land over my head, and that was more bearable than the noise at this hotel. The rooms were nice: I had a king suite; it was clean and basic. The kitchenette was very nice, all new stainless steel appliances, decent selection of kitchenware, granite countertops. There was a lot of room to "spread out", a marketing phrase they used that was true. I had 2 closets with a lot of space. I noticed that in some of the reviews, there were complaints about ants...I saw a few, but it didn't phase me- I had lived in Florida before, and know that bugs and lizzards are part of a package deal. However, I did receive several bites from something in the bed. One of the major issues that I dealt with besides the airplane noise was kid noise. Being on an extended business trip and working odd hours, it was painful to be woken up at 730 am by children running amuck and screaming. Or on the nights I got to sleep "early", people would be playing basketball at 1130pm. The staff there were amazing. I can not say enough good things about the women who worked at the desk. They were nice, polite, and helpful...something that I didn't experience in many other places during this trip.

Reviews.Title: “NOISY LOCATION, but lots of room for a family”
Reviews.Author: 1helpfultraveler
Reviews.Content: I should have checked the reviews before I booked this hotel, believe all the ones about the airport noises. ALL planes take off in this direction, it started about 5am, I never knew that many flights left so early!! We didn't experience the train, but tracks right next to property. The 2 bedroom accommodation was spacious enough, remember the 2nd bedroom is a loft so it isn't very private or dark. Once people are awake on the main floor the lights will bother someone sleeping upstairs. Great breakfast bar with full breakfast options as long as you don;t have an early flight since it is available from 7am - 10am. Would not stay again because of the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Room was great, if it wasn't for the airplanes”
Reviews.Author: eavega
Reviews.Content: We are a family with two young (3 and 5 year olds) children. We booked a 2 king bed suite. The setup was a living room, kitchen, and one bedroom downstairs, with its own bathroom and a double french door separating the bedroom from the living room. The upstairs was a loft, so it was open to the living room below, but also had its own bathroom. Pros: The kitchen was very clean and very modern appliances including fridge/freezer, oven, stove, and dishwasher coffee maker (small), microwave oven, and toaster. The room was very nice, very functional. Lots of closet space to put bags and other such items that were not being used for the stay. The beds were very comfortable. There was a TV in each of the sleeping areas as well as in the living room. The TV in the living room did have auxilary connections so you could plug a DVD player or other such device in. The breakfast provided was adequate, with small variety from day to day. Cons 1. You are right on the MIA approach. The planes are passing overhead close enough for you to see the treads on the wheels. needless to say the noise is almost overwhelming. The airplane traffic is almost constant from about 7 AM until about 9 PM. Even after 9 PM there is traffic, although there is less. If you have the misfortune to be there as we were when a cold front comes through and the winds shift, causing you to be on the takeoff path rather than the landing path, then you will hear almost constant noise until 2 AM or so. It seems there is a lot of outbound traffic in the wee hours of the morning. 2. The loft is dangerous with small children. the bed in the loft is on the pony wall that overlooks the living room, and kids will invariably climb on the bed in order to look out over the pony wall. I could easily see a child falling over the other side, which is at least a 15 foot drop. Our girls were not allowed up into the loft at all. 3. They advertise internet connectivity, but don't fool youself into thinking that it is Wi Fi. It is wired, and the only connection is inside the downstairs bedroom at the desk. There is no connection in the living room or in the upstairs loft. Since I didn't happen to pack a 100' ethernet cable with me, you are limited to working at the desk if you need network connectivity. 4. I did notice you were right on the train line, although we did not have a train go by while we were there. The hotel property does back up to a warehouse area, so I would be leery of the amount of security for the property. Overall the hotel is located in an industrial area with few restaurants. Luckily I lived in Miami for over 20 years, and in fact worked around the corner from that hotel, so I was very familiar with the area and where there were restaurants, markets, etc. Honestly if it wasn't for the planes, the hotel would've ranked very high for me. All I would've had to complain about was the internet connectivity limited to the downstairs bedroom, and that is a relatively minor inconvenience and easily remedied with a switch to wireless. The property was very well located since it has easy access to the Dolphin Expressway (836), which is the main east-west freeway in Miami. you were equidistant from the turnpike and the palmetto expressway (826), as well as several surface traffic arteries (87th Ave, 25th Street,).

Reviews.Title: “I checked out it was so bad.”
Reviews.Author: Gtravelgirl
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a lot of Marriotts, and this one just does not cut it. First problem, ANTS!!! Apparently, Miami has an ant problem, and this is not unique to this hotel. However, the hotel is garden-style, which I personally dislike because the security of the room is not good. I believe this set-up contributes to the ant problem as well. And the ants were everywhere in the room...not just the kitchen. I left an unopened box of doughnuts in the bag on the living room table, and it was covered in ants in the morning. The rooms are large and have been remodeled, but they are just mediocre. The room was very dark, the windows dirty, and there were dead bugs on the floor. The televisions are circa the 1980s, and you cannot plug electronics into them such as a DVD player. The location is not near anything except business parks and some local stores/restaurants. It is super convenient to US SOUTHCOM, but not worth it. Stay at the new Residence Inn near the airport. The commute is only 8 additional minutes, and the hotel is extremely nice with no ants.

Reviews.Title: “Planes,Trains and Automobiles”
Reviews.Author: Isshiah
Reviews.Content: well ..i read all the reveiws myslef but i still decided to stay there..Location was close to my business meetings and the mall i lost count of airplanes after 4 hours i was over 20.. logistical nightmare.. airport approach path,train tracks literally at front entrance everyafternoon in my 4 day stay a dang train went by.. i dont know which was more annoying.. highway a stones throw away.. The room it self was ok except for the crack in the ceiling in the bathroom. The bed was comfortable. and despite all the noise i actually slept really well.. the noise make sit hard to watch TV,talkon phone etc. The frequency of the airplanes did seem to reduce as it got later. i couldnt figure out why they would put a fireplace in a hotel room in Miami!!Plus i could cook my own meals etc.. and one morning i had to to rush to make my meeting leaving the kitchen a mess. room service actually wahed everything and placed my leftovers in the fridge for me..:)Ill post a video and in the video you can hear the planes go by as i talk

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: swsmith
Reviews.Content: The airplane noise was horrible. Do not stay at this hotel -- UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES! When we were checking in a plane when by and we asked the desk clerk if it was this noisy at night. She said no, that the planes used a different landing pattern at night. After listening to planes all night long, I asked the morning desk clerk why she told me that, and the clerk admitted that I had been lied to. Marriott should either close or sell this property!

Reviews.Title: “Residence Inn Miami charged fraudulent charges to our CC!! Horrible Experience!”
Reviews.Author: gapeach531
Reviews.Content: We would not have recommended this hotel based on the fact that most rooms do not have elevator access and you have to drag all your luggage up flights of stairs, plus the extreme noise from airplanes flying directly over the hotel...HOWEVER..... A month after our stay at the Residence Inn Miami Airport...fraudulent charges started posting on our credit card. So far 6 charges have posted....May 5,6,7,8,10,11 for $2,000...$1860...etc!!!! We have called the hotel and they are going to "try and have a manager call us." We have called the fraud dept at Chase Visa and may have to call the Miami police. DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and in the middle of nowhere”
Reviews.Author: pjeanne
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located very close to one of the runways of MIA airports. So close that you can physically feel each landing plane. :o( It is also located in the middle of nowhere, and, arriving at night I was quite apprehensive of staying there at the ground floor for the night. The room in itself was OK (a standard Residence Inn), the breakfast was quite nice, but all the same I decided to move to another hotel for the rest of my stay.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Hotel!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: judo_sensei
Reviews.Content: This hotel is everything a "First-Rate" hotel should be. The staff, quite obviously, has assimilated the concept critical to success in the hotel business: "SERVICE". Every single person with whom I interacted was friendly, helpful and, most importantly, courteous and professional. The room I was in was absolutely beautiful! It was exceptionally LARGE and well appointed. It had a full size refrigerator, stove and dishwasher. There was more than enough towels and the grounds are impeccable. The Front Desk staff were extremely courteous, helpful and professional. I would like to single out and commend Adriana and the Day Manager, Juan Quiroz. Both of these people could "write the book" to teach others how to act, respond, etc. when working with guests. I am even more impressed when I consider how young these people seem to be... The free HOT breakfast was wonderful and also in abundance. I will not hesitate to book another stay at this hotel when I return to Miami. Stay here... you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Good for a close-by meeting, but...”
Reviews.Author: politicalbug
Reviews.Content: It was a good location near my meeting, and I wanted some Rewards points. The rooms were nice but not great -- what you'd expect from a Residence Inn. The Bally's they allow you to use free of charge was useful for an early morning workout on the treadmill but not much more. The hotel's free breakfast was good for grabbing a quick bite before my meeting. Here's the catch -- bring earplugs. It won't block out all the noise from the planes. Nothing will. And then there are trains that run right on the edge of the property. It's not a quiet place at all. As much as I love Rewards points, I love a good nights sleep more. I will not be returning to this Residence Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Not good”
Reviews.Author: jdr1000
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nothing that I expected. Rooms go right into the street (not an enclosed building or property) and for some reason that did not made me feel secure. It is basically 4 to 5 double floor townhouses in a small block with 2 or 3 car entries to the street. Asked for a remodeled room, after getting to my car going to the room and carried the bags, it was not. So complained and got one. Then do all the car, bags and steps again. Only the center townhouses with three floors have elevators. the other two floor buildings do not. Internet did not work at all, After complaining to the front desk they told me that I had to call their internet provider directly. That is what I call service. Remodeled rooms look good and clean however the surroundings are very dirty since they are not finished with the remodeling part. Workers all day and you are basically staying there during construction. Their food offering at the front desk is very limited, I found the last Mac and cheese cup available. Will not say here again, By the way, plane noises and train passing noise is very loud. It is not touture, but for what I had to pay it is not worth the effort.

Reviews.Title: “Planes, Trains, and Automobiles”
Reviews.Author: av8ng
Reviews.Content: I am a professional aviator and would say that I like airplane noise, but this was ridiculous! When you see "Airport" in a hotel's name you would think that it is conveniently located to the airport. This hotel is right in the arrival/departure path of runway 8R/26L! For those who are not familiar with the runways at Miami Int'l, this is a long runway used for the larger aircraft. Once the air traffic lightens up around 11:00 p.m. the trains start. I was not aware that ear plugs were available. I had to suffer a week at this place due to a lack of rooms elsewhere (Super Bowl week). The only plus to this place is that you can get some killer pictures of aircraft landing and departing (and the free beer!).

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From the moment we opened the room door we were thrilled. Large, spacious room, well-equipped with all necessities. Daily cleaning...although a bit late but easy to understand why. It was home away from home. Our family visited Miami on a leisure trip - total four. The kids enjoyed the pool and mini sport area. Breakfast was complete with a variety of choices. Staff responded to all our queries. And yes the airplanes did fly over us continuously - fasinating sight despite the noise - didn't bother us in the least. Trains passed by about twice for the week. The hotel is located close to a bus stop on 84th Ave so moving around to various locations is not a problem. We toured the entire Dade county, visited the Metro Zoo and Seaquarium via the transit system. The longest we ever waited on a bus was 10 mins. Walmart, restaurants, grocery shopping is approximately a 10 min walk from the hotel. Spent 6 days. We would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “So Way Underrated!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms of this beautiful and comfortable hotel were very spacious and well-decorated and were kept immaculate by their friendly and very capable staff. We had a full kitchen, living room (with a fireplace) and bedroom and it was great to be able to stretch out and truly relax. My husband and I stayed here for two nights before leaving on a cruise on Monday, May 16 and we met our friends who were here for an entire week before we arrived, and they were just as comfortable and happy with their stay as we were. The breakfast buffet was very generous and everything was fresh and tasty. Of course, we were right near the airport and planes were flying overhead (which we of course expected), but this fact in no way created any problems with sleep for any of us, and we DID NOT have to use the ear plugs supplied by the Residence Inn staff. The only potential problem we might have had is that the hotel being so close to the airport is not really close to the mainstream of everything in Miami Beach and surrounding areas to see and do. However, our friends had their car and we were fortunate to be able to drive to wherever we wanted or needed to go. All in all, I really believe that for the $98 a night we paid, we truly got our money's worth and then some.

Reviews.Title: “Residence Inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Loved the size of the rooms and the staff tried really hard. Breakfast buffet was very basic and left a lot to be desired but hey it was free. Light sleepers beware... there is quite a bit of noise from the planes flying overhead as they land and the hotel is located immediately next to a train track. The ear plugs provided in each room will help. All the rooms had free Internet which was great. Overall I would stay there again if I had to but it is not at the top of my list of places to stay in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Be ready for planes landing ALL NIGHT!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed there one night and barely slept and unfortunately did not notice until the next morning that there WERE earplugs offered - not that it would have done much good I imagine! I laid down about 10PM and heard a plane land about every 30 minutes for the next couple of hours. I think I finally drifted off around Midnight until the 2am arrival! Then planes landed about every two hours after that and did not stop. If you plan to stay here, don't plan to sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel after all”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week in February with my family at this great hotel. The kids loved the room, the pool, the breakfast buff? and the basket ball field. Yes, you do occasionally hear an airplane or two but seldom during night. And yes, there is a railway next door with one or two trains passing by each week, but who cares? After staying at a few other hotels on the same trip this was definitely the best value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't check-out fast enough!”
Reviews.Author: debstarlight
Reviews.Content: Upon check-in I was allocated a suite on the 2nd floor - The Hotel does not provide a concierge service or an elevator. Unfortunately the hotel is too close the airport; directly in the flight path. In fact I was unlucky enough to be allocated a suite directly facing a railway track - rooms are NOT soundproof. After being subjected to the roars of countless airplanes flying overhead coupled with that of trains passing by at maximum velocity. At 1.49 am when I was finally able to doze off I made the decision to check out. Blood stained bathroom carpet was also not impressive. Upon check-out I overheard staff dealing with the complaints of another guess who from what i heard also wanted to change rooms.

HotelInfo.Name: Residence Inn Miami Airport West/Doral Area
HotelInfo.Address: 1212 NW 82nd Avenue, Miami, FL 33126
